chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Josephine Heck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or a combination of the two, or if not fully engaged perform 5 hours community service and complete 3 verifable job applications per week.

Absolute sobriety.
No contact with A.H. & J.C.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
No objection to transfer to Walworth County.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber for AA meetings, assessment/treatment, work, or school.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Charli
Case Called: 1:46 p.m.
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt.  Def appears in person with Atty John H Wallace.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to:
CT 2. (Substantial Battery- Intend Bodily Harm; PTAC, Use of Weapon)>> DRI
CT 3. (Maintain Drug Tafficking Place)>> DRI
COURT grants above.

PLEA: 
CT 1. (Armed Robbery with Use of Force)>> No Contest

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: S/H 10 years probation. CONDITIONS: 12 months Jail; Assessment/Treatment/Counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent; AODA and Follow up; Absolute Sobriety; No Contact with A.H. or J.C.; Maintain fulltime employment/schooling or a combination of the two or if not fully engaged- Preform 5 hours of Community Service and Complete 3 verifiable job applications per week; CC; DNA Sample & Surcharge;  95 days credit; Huber for AA, Meetings, Assesment/Treatment, work, or school. No objection to transfer to Walworth County. 

Adj: 2:02

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:30 am   
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty John Wallace. 
Officer Max Laporte (Wausau PD) sworn and testifies - identifies deft. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed. Reading Waived.
Plea: Not Guilty. 
Dates set: PTC set for 1/4/2016 at 1:40 pm with Br. 2 JA. 
Bond: Continued. 
Adj: 9:38 am

Preliminary Hearing at 12-23-2015 09:20 am.
Pre-trial conference at 01-04-2016 01:40 pm.

No contact with A.H. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.Absolute sobriety from drugs.
